alert.note: Alert for Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:26AM EDT until June 14 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...MUSKINGUM AND SOUTHEASTERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES... At 426 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Dennison to 8 miles west of Freeport to near Cambridge to near North Zanesville to 8 miles south of Hanover, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, New Philadelphia, Cambridge, Uhrichsville, Newcomerstown, Dennison, New Concord, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, and Midvale. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
